channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Terrible smell of waste and rubbish, 9th July
item.description:
Smell of waste circles on Ilderton road from south Bermondsey station down towards south end of the road frequently (in line with another recent report). Agree that without fixing this, the area won't develop in direction council has planned. Very unpleasant for visitors and even more so for residents especially when it's warm and windows / balconies are open. May well be affecting streets more widely but this is the one I travel down and live on. Have been living here 3 weeks and noticed almost straight away.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 217, Ilderton Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hoxton Hound obstructing Geffrye street, 9th July
item.description:
The Hoxton Hound is obstructing the busy walking and cycling section of Geffrye Street approaching Hoxton Station. Two large A-boards are put out daily, and recently extra chairs and tables have started appearing. Does the pub have permission for all this?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cremer Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Rats, rubbish and overgrown weeds at 302 Manor Road, 9th July
item.description:
This area has been in a terrible state for months. The grass is extremely overgrown, there is a large amount of litter, and rats are now visible every day. I have reported this directly to the council multiple times, but nothing has been done. This is directly in front of 302 Manor Road, at the corner with Barking Road (under the Newham Way flyover). This is a serious health hazard. Please address this as a priority.

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing Fly-Tipping Issue – Urgent Action Required, 9th July
item.description:
I am to reporting yet another incident of fly-tipping in Sondes Street SE17. Today, I discovered more rubbish that has been dumped in the area, including boxes containing address information that may be linked to the individual responsible. This is now the third time I have contacted you regarding this ongoing issue. Despite my previous reports, the problem persists and is becoming increasingly frustrating for local residents. I have previously requested that fly-tipping warning signs be installed in this location, as a potential deterrent. To date, no action appears to have been taken. I strongly urge the council to consider implementing signage and increased monitoring in this area as a matter of urgency. In the meantime, I will be raising this matter with my local MP to ensure that appropriate steps are taken to address this continuing and unacceptable problem.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sondes Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheelie bin dumbed on drive causing obstruction, 9th July
item.description:
Fly-Tipping/ Abandoned Waste and Obstruction at 21/23 Riverview Park, London, SE6 4PL Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to report an incident of illegally dumped waste at the following location: 21/23 Riverview Park, London, SE6 4PL. A wheelie bin was abandoned on the driveway of the aforementioned property today, July 9, 2025. The incident was captured on a Ring camera at 15:49, and the bin was physically discovered at approximately 19:20. The bin is causing a significant obstruction, impeding access to and from the premises. Furthermore, the bin is extremely heavy, suggesting it is full, and is emitting a strong and unpleasant odour, which is causing considerable distress. The contents of the bin are unknown, but the smell suggests they may be perishable and could pose a health and hygiene risk. This abandoned item constitutes an act of fly-tipping and is a cause for concern. I would be grateful if you could arrange for the urgent removal of this abandoned wheelie bin and its contents. We have video footage of the incident should you require it for your investigation. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Yours faithfully,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverview Park, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Peckham Hill Street- messy pavements, 9th July
item.description:
Peckham Hill Street has been forgotten by the street cleaners! Between Bird in bush road up to Peckham Library pavements require a good litter pickup and a proper sweep up 🧹 , lots of dead leaves, random rubbish, papers, cigarette butts, old plastic bottles etc. Please assist
